title: Chef, ex-owner indicted in $200K theft from NY restaurant
text:
SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y. (AP) - A former chef for an upstate New York restaurant and the eatery's former part-owner have been indicted on charges that they embezzled as much as $200,000 from the business.
The Daily Gazette of Schenectady reports ( http://bit.ly/1LLw5jo ) that 52-year-old John LaPosta and 55-year-old Tina Kruger of Rexford were each indicted Tuesday on charges of grand larceny, forgery and falsifying business records.
State police arrested them in April after investigators said $200,000 had been stolen form Maestro's, a downtown Saratoga Springs restaurant where LaPosta had been the longtime chef and Kruger was part-owner.
Authorities say the thefts occurred after the couple took over operation of the restaurant in 2011 and continued through September 2014, when Kruger's ownership interest ended.
LaPosta and Kruger both pleaded not guilty at their arraignment Wednesday and were released.
Information from: The Daily Gazette, http://www.dailygazette.com/
